Technique: ENGOBE; FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED
Name: Cylix
Description: Bitruncate cone-shaped cylix with a rounded rim, a curvature at middle height and a stable base with ring-shaped foot. Paste of an orangey colour and surface with reddish-coloured coating. In the upper half of the body, between the rim and the curvature, we find a painted decoration consisting of teardrop designs in groups of three, positioned vertically, in white and in black.
